title: Greek (1906) Old Testament in Greek (Codex Vaticanus) Vol 1-9 - OT
title_vernacular: Παλαιά Διαθήκη στα Ελληνικά (1906, Κώδικας Βατικανός, Τόμος 1-9)
description:
The 1906 publication "The Old Testament in Greek," edited by Alan England Brooke, D.D., is a significant scholarly work focused on the Greek translation of the Old Testament, known as the Septuagint. Brooke, an English academic and theologian, utilized the text of the Codex Vaticanus, one of the oldest and most important extant Greek manuscripts of the Bible, as the primary source for this work. Additionally, he supplemented the text with readings from other uncial manuscripts.

The critical apparatus accompanying the text in this nine-volume series presents the variants of the chief ancient authorities for the text of the Septuagint. This feature makes the work an invaluable resource for scholars engaged in textual criticism and the study of the Septuagint.

Alan England Brooke, born in 1863 and educated at Eton College and King's College, Cambridge, had a distinguished academic career. He was a Fellow of King's College from 1889 to 1926 and later served as its Provost from 1926 to 1933. Ordained as a priest in the Church of England in 1904, Brooke also held positions as Ely Professor of Divinity from 1916 to 1926 and Canon of Ely during the same period. Additionally, he served as an Honorary Chaplain to the King from 1918 until his death in 1939.

Brooke's work on the Old Testament in Greek according to the Codex Vaticanus is a testament to his scholarly rigor and dedication to the study of biblical texts. His edition remains a critical resource for understanding the Septuagint and the textual history of the Old Testament.
